## üõ†Ô∏è Essential R & Data Science Tools

### Quarto & Markdown Help
Since we use Quarto for all lab reports, these guides will help you format your text, equations, and tables:

* [**Data Visualization (ggplot2)**](https://rstudio.github.io/cheatsheets/html/data-visualization.html)
* [**Data Transformation (dplyr)**](https://rstudio.github.io/cheatsheets/html/data-transformation.html)
* [**Quarto Markdown Basics**](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html) ‚Äî Official guide for bolding, lists, and headers.
* [**Browse All Posit Cheat Sheets**](https://posit.co/resources/cheatsheets/)
* [**Formatting Equations (LaTeX)**](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html#equations) ‚Äî How to write professional math symbols.
* [**Table Syntax**](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/tables.html) ‚Äî How to organize data into accessible tables. 




### AI for Learning (Generative AI Policy)
In this course, we use AI as a **tutor, not a replacement**. 

* **Good use:** "Explain why this t-test code is giving me an error."
* **Bad use:** "Write the entire conclusion for Lab 12 for me."
* *Tip: Always double-check AI-generated code; it can sometimes suggest outdated packages!*

## üéì Dutchess Community College Support

### Academic Support & Tutoring
If you are struggling with the math or coding concepts, help is available:

* **The Math Center:** Located in Washington Center (Room 224). They offer walk-in tutoring for statistics.
* **Writing Center:** Excellent for help with your final project reports.
* **DCC Help Desk:** For issues with your DCC login or Microsoft 365. [Submit a Ticket](https://www.sunydutchess.edu/its)

### Accommodative Services
If you have a documented disability and require specific accommodations for this course, please visit the [Office of Accommodative Services](https://www.sunydutchess.edu/accommodativeservices/) in the Orcutt Student Center.

## üìä Practice Data Sources
Want to explore data outside of our labs? These sites offer free, clean datasets:

1.  **[NY.gov Open Data](https://data.ny.gov/):** Real data about New York State (similar to our enrollment data).
2.  **[Kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets):** A massive community for data science competitions and datasets.
3.  **[TidyTuesday](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday):** A weekly social data project in R.
